page.title: 04FARMING
page.content:
The first of the two farms which we studied in Chapelhall was Craigends.
This farm owned all its 181 acres of land and concentrated solely on dairy farming. Their livestock included, sheep and cattle of which there were four types: AYRSHIRE and FRESIAN,both of which were dairy cattle, and were milked twice a day, first at 6.00am and again at 4.00pm: and LIMIZEENS which is a French breed,and HERREFORDS. Both are beef cattle. The type of soil of the farm was partly heavy, and it only grew hay and silage.
